title: New Zealand Cricket Makes Historic Franchise Investment in MLC
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) and New Zealand Cricket (NZC) have partnered to establish one of the competition's new franchises in 2027, making NZC the first national governing body to invest directly in an international T20 league.

One of the new franchises will be operated by True North Sports (TNS), a US-based company managed by Sameer Mehta and Vijay Srinivasan, co-founders of MLC. According to a statement from NZC, 49ers Enterprises, the NFL team's investment arm, is one of the private equity investors in TNS.

As a result, NZC will have a stake in the team and an option to invest in a second franchise in the future. It will also provide high-performance and operational support, such as coaching, management, and support personnel, and integrate the franchise into New Zealand's domestic high-performance system. NZC will contribute its knowledge of cricket infrastructure and turf maintenance in a subsequent stage of development.

At the first MLC launch in 2023, Victoria and New South Wales teamed with the San Francisco Unicorns and Washington Freedom, respectively, but NZC's agreement goes much further. Later this year, the NZC-backed franchise is anticipated to reveal further information, including its name.

Oakland's Coliseum will host matches for the first time during the 2025 MLC season, which runs from June 13 to July 14. Among the current New Zealand players scheduled to participate are Finn Allen, Lockie Ferguson, Rachin Ravindra, and Devon Conway.

By 2027, MLC will have expanded from its current six clubs to eight, and by 2031, there are plans for further expansion, including the prospect of a franchise in Canada.
summary:
**Partnership and Franchise**: New Zealand Cricket (NZC) has partnered with MLC to establish a new franchise in 2027, making NZC the first national governing body to invest directly in an international T20 league. The franchise will be operated by True North Sports (TNS), a US-based company.

**Investment and Support**: NZC will have a stake in the team and an option to invest in a second franchise in the future. They will provide high-performance and operational support, including coaching, management, and support personnel, and integrate the franchise into New Zealand's domestic high-performance system.

**Upcoming Season**: Oakland's Coliseum will host matches for the first time during the 2025 MLC season, which runs from June 13 to July 14. Several current New Zealand players, including Finn Allen, Lockie Ferguson, Rachin Ravindra, and Devon Conway, are scheduled to participate.

**Future Expansion**: By 2027, MLC will expand from its current six clubs to eight, and by 2031, there are plans for further expansion, including the prospect of a franchise in Canada.

title: Tim Seifert joins San Francisco Unicorns for 2025 MLC season
body:
New Zealand wicketkeeper-batter is set for his first Major League Cricket (MLC) experience after signing with the San Francisco Unicorns for the 2025 season. The 30-year-old will reunite with New Zealand opening partner Finn Allen and former Northern Districts teammate Corey Anderson at the Unicorns.

Under Anderson‚Äôs leadership, the Unicorns finished as runners-up in MLC 2024.

Although Seifert and Allen are currently without central contracts from New Zealand Cricket (NZC), both have committed to being available for all of New Zealand‚Äôs T20I series ahead of the 2026 T20 World Cup. The explosive duo was recently reintroduced to New Zealand‚Äôs T20I setup for the home series against Pakistan, earning the nickname "New Zealand‚Äôs bash brothers" for their aggressive batting at the top.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve been following MLC from afar over the last couple of seasons, particularly keeping a close eye on some of the Kiwi contingent,‚Äù Seifert said. ‚ÄúI can't wait to get started this summer and add some more firepower to a team that‚Äôs already stacked with talent and hungry to go one better than last year.‚Äù

Unicorns head coach Shane Watson welcomed Seifert's signing, praising both his cricketing skills and character. ‚ÄúHis skills with the gloves will be a major asset, especially with the new wickets in Oakland and Fort Lauderdale offering some unknowns for spinners,‚Äù Watson said. ‚ÄúWith his current batting form, Tim will further strengthen our already dominant top order alongside Finn [Allen], Shorty [Matt Short], and Jake [Fraser-McGurk].‚Äù

Seifert and Allen are currently featuring in the Pakistan Super League (PSL).

Meanwhile, other MLC teams have also turned to New Zealand players. Michael Bracewell, key to New Zealand‚Äôs run to the Champions Trophy final in March, has been signed by MI New York (MINY), where he will join Trent Boult. Boult continues his association with the MI franchise across leagues like the MLC, SA20, and IPL.

Daryl Mitchell, who missed the 2024 season due to injury, has re-signed with the Texas Super Kings (TSK) for 2025. TSK have also retained Devon Conway and Noor Ahmad while adding Adam Milne, who previously played for Washington Freedom, and South African duo Nandre Burger and Donovan Ferreira from Joburg Super Kings.

Seattle Orcas have appointed former New Zealand star Ross Taylor as their ambassador for MLC 2025, with former England batter Ian Bell stepping in as the team‚Äôs new batting coach.

In a significant development, New Zealand Cricket has become the first national governing body to invest directly in an overseas T20 league, partnering with MLC to launch a new team when the league expands in 2027.

The 2025 edition of Major League Cricket will run from June 13 to July 14, with Oakland's Coliseum set to host matches for the first time.
summary:
**Player Signings:**

* Tim Seifert, New Zealand wicketkeeper-batter, has signed with the San Francisco Unicorns for the 2025 season, reuniting with Finn Allen and Corey Anderson.
* Michael Bracewell has been signed by MI New York, joining Trent Boult.
* Daryl Mitchell has re-signed with the Texas Super Kings for 2025.
* Adam Milne has joined the Texas Super Kings.
* Nandre Burger and Donovan Ferreira have joined the Texas Super Kings from Joburg Super Kings.

**Team News:**

* The San Francisco Unicorns finished as runners-up in MLC 2024 under Corey Anderson's leadership.
* Shane Watson is the head coach of the San Francisco Unicorns.
* Ross Taylor has been appointed as the ambassador for Seattle Orcas for MLC 2025.
* Ian Bell has been appointed as the new batting coach for Seattle Orcas.

**Tournament Details:**

* The 2025 edition of MLC will run from June 13 to July 14.
* Oakland's Coliseum will host matches for the first time in MLC 2025.

**Other News:**

* New Zealand Cricket has become the first national governing body to invest directly in an overseas T20 league, partnering with MLC to launch a new team when the league expands in 2027.

body:

title: üì∞ NZ Cricket's bold deal to transform the Black Caps' future
body:
By Neil Reid

New Zealand Cricket has partnered with the financial backers of a new franchise in Major League Cricket ‚Äì a competition which has a value of at least $200 million ‚Äì with the move partly to try to retain the Black Caps‚Äô top talent.

The bold move is a crucial step from cricket bosses that could help keep some of our leading players ‚Äì and coaches ‚Äì available for Black Caps duty, instead of opting to effectively become freelancers on the global Twenty20 stage.

The sporting body has signed a deal with US-based company True North Sports Ventures (TNS) for the creation of a new franchise in North America‚Äôs Major League Cricket (MLC).

And if the franchise agreement goes well, New Zealand Cricket could become investors and backers in a second franchise in the league in 2031.

The initial team ‚Äì yet to be formally named or have their location confirmed ‚Äì will make their debut in the 2027 season.

The deal is the first time a full member of the International Cricket Council has partnered with a franchise in a top-level professional cricket league.

New Zealand Cricket (NZC) chief executive Scott Weenink said as part of the deal, the sporting body would provide high-performance and operational support, including coaching, management and support staff, as well as integrating the franchise into NZC‚Äôs domestic high-performance ecosystem.

‚ÄúThis agreement marks a unique and exciting milestone for NZC,‚Äù Weenink said.

‚ÄúAs franchise cricket grows globally, NZC needs to adapt to seize strategic opportunities that ensure the sustainability of our cricket network.

‚ÄúThis helps diversify our revenue streams, expands our global brand and fan base and creates new talent development and retention pathways for both our players and coaches.‚Äù

The issue of retention of stars for international duty ‚Äì and of younger players who are coming through the ranks ‚Äì has been an issue facing a growing number of national cricketing bodies in the face of cashed-up T20 cricket leagues around the world.

That includes NZC, who have seen an increasing number of players turn down central contracts, such as former captain Kane Williamson, Finn Allen and Devon Conway, in favour of cashing in at T20 leagues around the world ‚Äì including those that would clash with Black Caps commitments.

Top players in the US league can earn up to $200,000 for playing a minimum of five matches in the competition.

That is a salary that makes MLC one of the most lucrative T20 leagues in the world for leading players.

The value of year-long NZC contracts to leading Black Caps hopefuls ranges from $523,396 to $367,197. The top domestic cricket contract provided by NZC for a season is $102,707.

Weenink said the partnership between NZC and TNS was a historic move and believed it would strengthen its presence in the world‚Äôs most lucrative sporting market.

A location for the franchise was yet to be confirmed.

But TNS has been ‚Äúexploring‚Äù several potential lucrative markets across North America, including Toronto and Atlanta.

While America is yet to make its presence felt hugely on the international cricket scene, it is a nation where cricket has a growing profile.

The US national team surprised many by being very competitive in the 2024 T20 World Cup, beating Pakistan in a Super Over and giving South Africa and India a few frights during eventual losses to those star-studded sides.

The MLC competition is one that has huge potential to grow.

It is estimated there are 25 million cricket fans in the US ‚Äì and cricket is set to get another profile boost when it features as a medal sport at the 2028 LA Olympics.

America‚Äôs professional T20 league was launched in 2023 and currently has six franchises ‚Äì the Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, the San Francisco Unicorns, the Seattle Orcas, the Texas Super Kings and the Washington Freedom.

The financial clout behind the league is such that the combined value of investors in the current franchises is worth a staggering $220 billion.

Investors in those six current franchises include property moguls, the chair of a major healthcare company, Microsoft boss Satya Nadella and Indian actor Shah Rukh Khan.

MLC co-founders Sameer Mehta and Vijay Srinivasan are the majority owners of entities which hold exclusive rights to own and operate two MLC expansion franchises, the first of which will be launched by TNS in 2027.

The deal will also see NZC offer expertise in cricket infrastructure and turf management.

MLC ‚Äì which achieved ‚ÄúList A‚Äù status before its 2024 season ‚Äì is played over a duration of up to four weeks during June and July. Expansion plans will see up to 10 teams taking part in 2031.

It is broadcast in the US via Willow TV, as well as being shown globally, including in New Zealand.

The roster of the six teams currently includes Black Caps Matt Henry, Rachin Ravindra, Finn Allen and Trent Boult.

Overseas stars include Pat Cummins, Travis Head, Steve Smith, and David Miller.

Weenink also confirmed NZC has become a foundation investor in TNS, with the ability to make a more substantial equity investment before the end of 2025.

He said MLC was a world-class T20 tournament and he was proud to align with Mehta, Srinivasan and the TNS investor group to drive cricket‚Äôs growth in North America.

Weenink said NZC would be joining an array of world-class, global sports, high-net-worth and private equity investors in TNS, including 49ers Enterprises (the investment arm of the NFL‚Äôs San Francisco 49ers), which boasts an enviable portfolio of global sports assets, including recently promoted English Championship side, Leeds United, who will play in the Premier League again next season.

Mehta and Srinivasan co-founded Willow TV, North America‚Äôs premier cricket broadcaster, then co-founded MLC and led its successful launch in 2023.

‚ÄúTNS is delighted to partner with NZC, an organisation admired for its sustained success despite limited financial and playing resources compared to other international cricketing bodies,‚Äù Mehta said.

‚ÄúAs founders of start-ups that have rapidly grown to established businesses, we see NZC as a perfect fit for our new franchise.

‚ÄúWith NZC‚Äôs expertise, our expansion franchise will elevate MLC‚Äôs world-class T20 product and support cricket‚Äôs rapid growth in our region.

‚ÄúThe potential for cricket in North America is immense and we look forward to working with NZC to deliver on both our ambitions and theirs, including broader strategic and corporate opportunities globally.‚Äù
summary:
**Partnership**: New Zealand Cricket (NZC) has partnered with US-based company True North Sports Ventures (TNS) to create a new franchise in the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament in North America.

**Franchise Details**: The new franchise, yet to be named or located, will debut in the 2027 season. NZC will provide high-performance and operational support, including coaching, management, and support staff.

**Retaining Top Talent**: The partnership aims to retain top New Zealand players and coaches, who may opt for lucrative T20 leagues over international duty.

**MLC Tournament**: The MLC tournament has a value of at least $200 million and is one of the most lucrative T20 leagues in the world. Top players can earn up to $200,000 for playing a minimum of five matches.

**Growth Potential**: The MLC tournament has huge growth potential, with an estimated 25 million cricket fans in the US and cricket set to feature as a medal sport at the 2028 LA Olympics.

**Existing Franchises**: The current six franchises in the MLC tournament include the Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, the San Francisco Unicorns, the Seattle Orcas, the Texas Super Kings, and the Washington Freedom.

**Investors**: The combined value of investors in the current franchises is worth a staggering $220 billion, including property moguls, the chair of a major healthcare company, Microsoft boss Satya Nadella, and Indian actor Shah Rukh Khan.
